content: 1 In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, on the first day of the month, came the word of Jehovah by the prophet Haggai unto Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,
content_old: 1 In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, on the first day of the month, came the word of Jehovah by the prophet Haggai unto Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,

content: 2 Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, saying, This people say, The time is not come, the time that Jehovah’s house should be built.
content_old: 2 Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, saying, This people say, The time is not come, the time that Jehovah’s house should be built.

content: 3 And the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet, saying,
content_old: 3 And the word of Jehovah came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

content: 4 Is it time for you that ye should dwell in your wainscoted houses, while this house lieth waste?
content_old: 4 Is it time for you that ye should dwell in your wainscoted houses, while this house lieth waste?

content: 5 And now thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.
content_old: 5 And now thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.

content: 6 Ye have sown much, and bring in little; ye eat, but are not satisfied; ye drink, but are not filled with drink; ye clothe yourselves, but there is none warm; and he that earneth wages earneth wages for a bag with holes.
content_old: 6 Ye have sown much, and bring in little; ye eat, but are not satisfied; ye drink, but are not filled with drink; ye clothe yourselves, but there is none warm; and he that earneth wages earneth wages for a bag with holes.

content: 7 Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.
content_old: 7 Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Consider your ways.

content: 8 Go up to the mountain and bring wood, and build the house, and I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, saith Jehovah.
content_old: 8 Go up to the mountain and bring wood, and build the house, and I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, saith Jehovah.

content: 9 Ye looked for much, and behold it was little; and when ye brought it home, I blew upon it. Wherefore? saith Jehovah of hosts. Because of my house that lieth waste, whilst ye run every man to his own house.
content_old: 9 Ye looked for much, and behold it was little; and when ye brought it home, I blew upon it. Wherefore? saith Jehovah of hosts. Because of my house that lieth waste, whilst ye run every man to his own house.

content: 10 Therefore over you the heavens withhold their dew, and the earth withholdeth its fruit.
content_old: 10 Therefore over you the heavens withhold their dew, and the earth withholdeth its fruit.

content: 11 And I called for a drought upon the land, and upon the mountains, and upon the corn, and upon the new wine, and upon the oil, and upon that which the ground bringeth forth, and upon man, and upon cattle, and upon all the labour of the hands.
content_old: 11 And I called for a drought upon the land, and upon the mountains, and upon the corn, and upon the new wine, and upon the oil, and upon that which the ground bringeth forth, and upon man, and upon cattle, and upon all the labour of the hands.

content: 12 And Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and all the remnant of the people, hearkened to the voice of Jehovah their God, and the words of Haggai the prophet, according as Jehovah their God had sent him, and the people feared before Jehovah.
content_old: 12 And Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and all the remnant of the people, hearkened to the voice of Jehovah their God, and the words of Haggai the prophet, according as Jehovah their God had sent him, and the people feared before Jehovah.

content: 13 Then spoke Haggai, Jehovah’s messenger, in Jehovah’s message unto the people, saying, I am with you, saith Jehovah.
content_old: 13 Then spoke Haggai, Jehovah’s messenger, in Jehovah’s message unto the people, saying, I am with you, saith Jehovah.

content: 14 And Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people; and they came and worked at the house of Jehovah of hosts, their God,
content_old: 14 And Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people; and they came and worked at the house of Jehovah of hosts, their God,

content: 1 In the seventh month, on the one and twentieth day of the month, came the word of Jehovah by the prophet Haggai, saying,
content_old: 1 In the seventh month, on the one and twentieth day of the month, came the word of Jehovah by the prophet Haggai, saying,

content: 2 Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying,
content_old: 2 Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying,

content: 3 Who is left among you that saw this house in its former glory? and how do ye see it now? Is it not as nothing in your eyes?
content_old: 3 Who is left among you that saw this house in its former glory? and how do ye see it now? Is it not as nothing in your eyes?

content: 4 But now be strong, Zerubbabel, saith Jehovah; and be strong, Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest; and be strong, all ye people of the land, saith Jehovah, and work: for I am with you, saith Jehovah of hosts.
content_old: 4 But now be strong, Zerubbabel, saith Jehovah; and be strong, Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest; and be strong, all ye people of the land, saith Jehovah, and work: for I am with you, saith Jehovah of hosts.

content: 5 The word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt, and my Spirit, remain among you: fear ye not.
content_old: 5 The word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt, and my Spirit, remain among you: fear ye not.

content: 6 For thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry land;
content_old: 6 For thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry land;

content: 7 and I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come; and I will fill this house with glory, saith Jehovah of hosts.
content_old: 7 and I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come; and I will fill this house with glory, saith Jehovah of hosts.

content: 8 The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith Jehovah of hosts.
content_old: 8 The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith Jehovah of hosts.

content: 9 The latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former, saith Jehovah of hosts; and in this place will I give peace, saith Jehovah of hosts.
content_old: 9 The latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former, saith Jehovah of hosts; and in this place will I give peace, saith Jehovah of hosts.

content: 10 On the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of Jehovah by Haggai the prophet, saying,
content_old: 10 On the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of Jehovah by Haggai the prophet, saying,

content: 11 Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,
content_old: 11 Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,

content: 12 If one bear holy flesh in the skirt of his garment, and with his skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any food—shall it become holy? And the priests answered and said, No.
content_old: 12 If one bear holy flesh in the skirt of his garment, and with his skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any food—shall it become holy? And the priests answered and said, No.

content: 13 And Haggai said, If one that is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, is it become unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.
content_old: 13 And Haggai said, If one that is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, is it become unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.

content: 14 Then answered Haggai and said, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, saith Jehovah, and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.
content_old: 14 Then answered Haggai and said, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, saith Jehovah, and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.

content: 15 And now, I pray you, consider from this day and onward, from before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of Jehovah,
content_old: 15 And now, I pray you, consider from this day and onward, from before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of Jehovah,

content: 16 —before those days were, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were but ten; when one came to the vat to draw out fifty press-measures, there were but twenty.
content_old: 16 —before those days were, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were but ten; when one came to the vat to draw out fifty press-measures, there were but twenty.

content: 17 I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the work of your hands; and ye turned not to me, saith Jehovah.
content_old: 17 I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the work of your hands; and ye turned not to me, saith Jehovah.

content: 18 Consider, I pray you, from this day and onward, from the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, from the day that the foundation of Jehovah’s temple was laid, consider it.
content_old: 18 Consider, I pray you, from this day and onward, from the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, from the day that the foundation of Jehovah’s temple was laid, consider it.

content: 19 Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, the vine, and the fig-tree, and the pomegranate, and the olive-tree have not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.
content_old: 19 Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, the vine, and the fig-tree, and the pomegranate, and the olive-tree have not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.

content: 20 And the word of Jehovah came the second time unto Haggai on the four and twentieth day of the month, saying,
content_old: 20 And the word of Jehovah came the second time unto Haggai on the four and twentieth day of the month, saying,

content: 21 Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;
content_old: 21 Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;

content: 22 and I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the nations; and I will overthrow the chariots, and those that ride therein; and the horses and their riders shall come down, every one by the sword of his brother.
content_old: 22 and I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the nations; and I will overthrow the chariots, and those that ride therein; and the horses and their riders shall come down, every one by the sword of his brother.
